intro: Campanula peirescifolia, commonly known as the bellflower of Peiresc, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It features upright stems covered in soft, hairy foliage and produces clusters of bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue or violet. The flowers are typically 2–4 cm in diameter and bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
